title: Quiz 3: Eukaryotic Microbes (Fungi & Algae)
description: Evaluate your knowledge of eukaryotic microorganisms, including fungal structures, reproduction, and the major groups of algae.

questions.question: What is the primary component of the fungal cell wall?
questions.explanation: Fungal cell walls are characteristically made of chitin, whereas plants use cellulose and bacteria use peptidoglycan.
questions.hint: It's also found in insect exoskeletons.

questions.question: A mass of fungal hyphae visible to the unaided eye is called a ___BLANK___.
questions.explanation: The mycelium is the vegetative part of a fungus, consisting of a network of fine white filaments (hyphae).

questions.question: Match the fungal phylum with its representative organism:
questions.explanation: Zygomycota=Bread mold; Basidiomycota=Mushrooms; Ascomycota=Sac fungi; Deuteromycota=Imperfect fungi.

questions.question: Which of the following statements about Algae are TRUE? (Select all that apply)

options.text: They lack true roots, stems, and leaves.
They play major roles in global Carbon and Oxygen cycling.

questions.explanation: Algae are aquatic photoautotrophs that lack complex plant structures but are vital for global ecology.

questions.question: What is the symbiotic alliance between a fungus and an alga (or cyanobacterium) called?
questions.explanation: A lichen is a composite organism capable of living in harsh environments through this mutualistic relationship.
questions.hint: It grows on rocks and trees.

questions.question: Which division of algae contains silica in their cell walls?
questions.explanation: Diatoms (Bacillariophyta) have distinct cell walls made of silica (glass-like).

questions.question: Fungi are autotrophs that produce their own food through photosynthesis.
questions.explanation: Fungi are heterotrophs (chemoheterotrophs); they obtain nutrients by absorption, not photosynthesis.

questions.question: Arrange the fungal classification groups from largest number of species to 'Imperfect':

richContent.content: Note: This is a conceptual ordering based on general prominence in the notes.

questions.explanation: Ascomycota is the largest phylum. Deuteromycota is a holding group for fungi without observed sexual cycles.

questions.question: What is the economic importance of 'Penicillium' molds?
questions.explanation: Penicillium is famous for the antibiotic Penicillin and for ripening cheeses (e.g., Roquefort).
